title: Fairness and Non-Discrimination in Career Guidance
content: Automated career guidance systems must not discriminate against individuals based on gender, ethnicity, socioeconomic background, age, or disability. Recommendations should be based solely on relevant qualifications, interests, and competencies.
source: OECD AI Principles; EU Ethics Guidelines (abstracted)

title: Bias Prevention and Risk Awareness
content: Career recommendation systems should actively identify and mitigate potential sources of bias in data and decision logic. Historical patterns must not be blindly reproduced if they reinforce inequality or exclusion.
source: EU Ethics Guidelines for Trustworthy AI (abstracted)

title: Transparency and Explainability
content: Users must be able to understand why a specific job or learning path was recommended. Systems should provide clear, human-readable explanations that reference the criteria and data sources used.
source: OECD AI Principles; NIST AI RMF (abstracted)

title: Responsible Use of Personal Data
content: Only data that is necessary for career guidance should be processed. Sensitive personal attributes must not be used for decision-making. Data handling should follow principles of data minimization and purpose limitation.

title: Human Oversight and Accountability
content: Automated recommendations should support, not replace, human judgment. Users must be able to question or override recommendations, and responsibility for outcomes must remain with human decision-makers.
source: OECD AI Principles; NIST AI RMF (abstracted)
